pageContext.claim: “We'll just have to tariff those cars coming in. That's a lot of money coming in to the coffers of the United States.”
pageContext.analysis: The cost of tariffs is often passed onto consumers so ultimately it would be paid out of the pockets of Americans buying imported cars. In effect, then, money would not be coming into the United States but would be a transfer from U.S. residents to the U.S. government.
